memberdef.argsstring: (core::resource::cache_t &cache, const core::resource::metadata &metaData, psl::meta::file *metaFile, psl::string8::view name, uint32_t deviceIndex=std::numeric_limits< uint32_t >::max())
memberdef.name: context

simplesect.para: the physical device properties (for e.g. checking device limits)
the physical device features (for e.g. checking if a feature is available)
the available memory (type) properties for the physical device
the command_pool that commands can be enqueued on.
the descriptor pool for allocating various pipeline descriptors.
the device queue for enqueuing commands.
the queue index the graphics pipeline is running on.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t typeBits, const vk::MemoryPropertyFlags &properties, uint32_t *typeIndex) const noexcept
memberdef.name: memory_type

parameterdescription.para: the MemoryRequirements you get back from vulkan query operations that resquest the requirements for resources (like textures and buffers).
the MemoryPropertyFlags of the requested memory type (i.e. should it be device local, or host, etc...).
the location to store the memory_type index in (on success).

simplesect.para: if the current context supports a memory type with the specific properties.

parameterdescription.para: the MemoryRequirements you get back from vulkan query operations that resquest the requirements for resources (like textures and buffers).
the MemoryPropertyFlags of the requested memory type (i.e. should it be device local, or host, etc...).

simplesect.para: a memory type index that supports the given properties.

briefdescription.para: flushes all operations on the given commandbuffer and potentially free it at the end.

parameterdescription.para: the command buffer to execute the operations on.
defines if we should free the command buffer at the end (true) or not (false).

simplesect.para: the device index of the current physical graphics device.
true in case the given extension is supported.

parameterdescription.para: optionally returns the revision version number.

detaileddescription.para: a context encapsulated a physical device (GPU), as well as a instance of the graphics context on the driver. it is the single point of information that many operations need in Vulkan, so that those operations know who will be executing them. As such, the context class is fundamental, and will be passed around a lot. It is often one of the first objects to be created, and one of the last to be destroyed in a most applications.
